Point85 Units of Measure
IntroductionLibraryApplicationBlogAbout

About

The Point 85 Caliper library project manages units of measure and conversions between them. Caliper is designed to be lightweight and simple to use, yet comprehensive. It includes a large number of pre-defined units of measure commonly found in science, engineering, technology, finance and the household. These recognized systems of measurement include the International System of Units (SI), International Customary, United States and British Imperial. Custom units of measure can also be created in the Caliper unified measurement system. Custom units are specific to a trade or industry such as industrial packaging where units of can, bottle, case and pallet are typical. Custom units can be added to the unified system for units that are not pre-defined.

Point 85 maintains these open source projects hosted by GitHub repositories:

  • Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE): This project and its subprojects manages Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE).
  • OEE Operations: This project manages the Vaadin operator application.
  • OEE Mobile: This Flutter/Dart project manages the iOS and Android mobile applications as well as the macOS, Linux, Windows and Chrome/Edge applications.
  • Caliper: This Java project manages units of measure and the conversions between them.
  • Caliper Sharp: This C# library project manages units of measure and the conversions between them.
  • PyCaliper: This Python library project manages units of measure and the conversions between them.
  • Shift: This Java library project manages work schedules.
  • ShiftSharp: This C# library project manages work schedules.
  • PyShift: This Python library project manages work schedules.
  • Kent Randall
